element.name: Lovecraft Patrons
element.description: Subclasses Specific to Various Great Old Ones of the Cthulhu Mythos

description.p: Also known as the Source of Uncleanliness, Abhoth is an Outer God depicted as an ooze or slime from which monsters and unnamable horrors crawl from. Followers of Abhoth tend to spread disease and carry oozes around with them to symbolize their patron.
Abhoth lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

Starting at 1st level, you are accustomed to unsanitary conditions, slime, rot, dust, rust, and maggots alike. You are immune to disease. Additionally, you have advantage on saving throws against the poisoned condition. You also have advantage on ability checks made to identify and treat diseases.

sheet.description: You are immune to disease. Additionally, you have advantage on saving throws against the poisoned condition. You also have advantage on ability checks made to identify and treat diseases.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, you can temporarily shift the cells in your body to split and reform. As an action, you can end one grappled condition on yourself.

sheet.description: You can end one grappled condition on yourself.

description.p: Beginning at 10th level, you gain more control over your oozelike body and can shift your organs as you please. You do not take extra damage from critical hits. Additionally, you can shift your organs and body parts as you wish, but not your skeletal structure.

sheet.description: You do not take extra damage from critical hits. Additionally, you can shift your organs and body parts as you wish, but not your skeletal structure.

description.p: At 14th level, the cells of your body are able to harm those that harm you. A creature within 5 feet of you that hits you with a melee attack must make a Constitution saving throw against your warlock spell save DC. On a failure, the creature is poisoned until the end of its next turn. Creatures that are immune to the poisoned condition are not immune to this feature but instead make their saving throw with advantage. Creatures grappling you automatically fail this saving throw.

sheet.description: A creature within 5 feet of you that hits you with a melee attack must make a Constitution saving throw against your warlock spell save DC. On a failure, the creature is poisoned until the end of its next turn. Creatures that are immune to the poisoned condition are not immune to this feature but instead make their saving throw with advantage. Creatures grappling you automatically fail this saving throw.

description.p: Azathoth is seen as a chaotic being, always in flux. He is constantly creating, destroying, and recreating. As such, his followers do the same, bending reality to their will, creating or destroying something so that the cycle may repeat.
Azathoth lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

Starting at 1st level, you are granted similar powers to the Blind Idiot God. You do not have to see your target in order to cast spells. Additionally, you gain blindsight out to a radius of 10 feet. At 14th level, this radius increases to 20 feet.

sheet.description: You do not have to see your target in order to cast spells. You have blindsight out to a radius of {{daemon-sultan:range}} feet.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, as an action, you can touch a creature and utter the last syllable of the secret name of Azathoth. Roll 1d6 and consult the Dread Curse of Azathoth table. That ability score is reduced to 1. Then the targetâ€™s corresponding ability score is reduced by the same amount that your ability score was reduced by to a minimum of 1. If your or your opponentâ€™s Intelligence is reduced below 3, you and/or the target cannot speak, read, or understand language and cannot cast spells requiring verbal components.

sheet.description: You can touch a creature and utter the last syllable of the secret name of Azathoth. Roll 1d6 and consult the Dread Curse of Azathoth table. That ability score is reduced to 1. Then the targetâ€™s corresponding ability score is reduced by the same amount that your ability score was reduced by to a minimum of 1.

description.p: Beginning at 10th level, you can radiate an aura of entropy. As a bonus action, you can roll a d6 and consult the Nuclear Chaos table. The effects affect an 60-foot sphere that is centered on you and moves with you. This feature lasts a number of rounds equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1).
Once you use this feature, you canâ€™t use it again until you finish a long rest.

tr.td: Damage types from spells change to a new type. Consult the Damage Type table.

Spells of 1st level or higher that deal damage now heal the target(s) for the same amount. Spells of 1st level or higher that would heal a creature now deal necrotic damage for the same amount. This damage ignores resistance to necrotic damage.
The range of spells change. Consult the Range table.

Spells that require one or more creatures to make a saving throw now require you to make a ranged spell attack at each target. Spells that require you to make a ranged spell attack now require the targets to make a Dexterity saving throw.
The schools of spells cast change to a new type. Consult the School Type table.
Spells with a casting time of 1 action now have a casting time of 1 bonus action. Spells with a casting time of 1 bonus action now have a casting time of 1 action.

sheet.description: You can roll a d6 and consult the Nuclear Chaos table. The effects affect an 60-foot sphere that is centered on you and moves with you. This feature lasts {{nuclear-chaos:duration}} rounds.

description.p: At 14th level, you understand the higher workings of space and matter and can bend it to your will. All spaces within 30 feet of you are treated as adjacent to you. You and other creatures cannot benefit from flanking with this feature unless you would benefit from it without the use of this feature. You cannot make attacks of opportunity with this feature unless you would be able to make one without the use of this feature.
Addtitionally, once on your turn, you can spend 5 feet of movement to teleport to one space within 30 feet.
Once you use this feature, you canâ€™t use it again until you do not move on your turn.

sheet.description: All spaces within 30 feet of you are treated as adjacent to you. You and other creatures cannot benefit from flanking with this feature unless you would benefit from it without the use of this feature. You cannot make attacks of opportunity with this feature unless you would be able to make one without the use of this feature. Addtitionally, once on your turn, you can spend 5 feet of movement to teleport to one space within 30 feet.

description.p: The dreamer of Râ€™lyeh is depicted as a large human, dragon, octopus hybrid rising out of the ocean. Great Cthulhu reaches out to his followers in dreams, most being maddening. His followers are found close to the sea, especially near where the sunken city of Râ€™lyeh lies.
Cthulhu lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

Starting at 1st level, you can read, speak, and write Râ€™lyehian. Râ€™lyehian is a language that sounds like a mix of Deep Speech and gibberish with a nearly incomprehensible grammatical structure and words that are hard to pronounce with common, humanoid mouths and vocal chords.
Additionally, you can understand all written ciphers and codes and have advantage on ability checks made to figure out riddles and word-related puzzles.

sheet.description: You can understand all written ciphers and codes and have advantage on ability checks made to figure out riddles and word-related puzzles.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, you can reach into the minds of others and lock them down. As an action, you can target one creature within 30 feet of you that you can see. It must make an Intelligence saving throw or become stunned until the end of your next turn. You can use a bonus action on subsequent turns to subject the same creature to this feature. If you target a different creature, you must use an action to use this feature.

sheet.description: Target one creature within 30 feet of you that you can see to make an Intelligence saving throw or be stunned until the end of your next turn. You can use a bonus action on subsequent turns to subject the same creature to this feature.

description.p: Beginning at 10th level, Cthulhu bestows you with powers while you dream. While you are asleep, you do not age and canâ€™t be aged magically. While maintaining a normal sleep schedule, for every 3 years that pass, you only age 2 years. You can also sleep for any amount of time you choose and do not require food, drink, or air while doing so.
Additionally, you have resistance to all damage and immunity to psychic damage while you are asleep.

sheet.description: While you are asleep, you do not age and canâ€™t be aged magically. You can also sleep for any amount of time you choose and do not require food, drink, or air while doing so. Additionally, you have resistance to all damage and immunity to psychic damage while you are asleep.

description.p: At 14th level, you can become an avatar of Cthulhu himself. As an action, you can transform into a semblence of Cthulhu. Your size increases by one category and you gain temporary hit points equal to twice your warlock level. While transformed, as a bonus action, you can cast the dissonant whispers spell at 1st level without expending a spell slot. The transformation ends after 1 minute, when you end it as an action, when you fall unconscious, or die.

sheet.description: You can transform into a semblence of Cthulhu for up to 1 minute. Your size increases by one category and you gain {{cthulu-nalffhtagn:temp-hp}} temporary hit points. While transformed, as a bonus action, you can cast the dissonant whispers spell at 1st level without expending a spell slot.

description.p: Father Dagon and Mother Hydra are said to be the gods of the Deep Ones, amphibious and frightening humanoids that live deep within the oceans. It has long been speculated whether Dagon and Hydra are deities or merely gigantic, mutated Deep Ones with long lifespans.
Father Dagon and Mother Hydra let you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.
description.h5: FATHER DAGON AND MOTHER HYDRA EXPANDED SPELLS

description.p: Starting at 1st level, your body starts to mutate to a more fish or frog-like form. You randomly gain a feature from the Innsmouth Mutation table. With your DMâ€™s discretion, you can choose which feature you gain. You gain an additional, random feature at 6th level and at 10th level.
Additionally, you have advantage on Intelligence (Nature) checks and Intelligence (Religion) checks made to remember information on denizens and deities of the sea.

tr.td: Your unarmed strikes now deal slashing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier.
You gain darkvision out to a radius of 30 feet. If you already have darkvision, its range increases by 30 feet.
You can breathe in air and water.
You can speak to creatures with a swimming speed as if under the speak with animals spell.
You gain a +1 bonus to your AC while unarmored or wearing light armor.
You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill.
You have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape grapples.
You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

sheet.description: You have advantage on Nature and Religion checks made to remember information on denizens and deities of the sea.

description.p: Your unarmed strikes now deal slashing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier.

sheet.description: Your unarmed strikes deal 1d{{innsmouth-claws:die-type}} + {{strength:modifier}} slashing damage.

description.p: You gain darkvision out to a radius of 30 feet. If you already have darkvision, its range increases by 30 feet.
You can breathe in air and water.

sheet.description: You can breathe in air and water.

description.p: You can speak to creatures with a swimming speed as if under the speak with animals spell.

sheet.description: You can speak to creatures with a swimming speed as if under the speak with animals spell.

description.p: You gain a +1 bonus to your AC while unarmored or wearing light armor.
You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill.
You have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape grapples.

sheet.description: You have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape grapples.

description.p: You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

Starting at 6th level, your scream becomes inhuman and utterly disturbing. As an action, you can emit a cry. Any creature you choose within 60 feet that can hear you must make a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you until the start of your next turn.

sheet.description: You can emit a cry. Any creature you choose within 60 feet that can hear you must make a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you until the start of your next turn.

description.p: Beginning at 10th level, you feel the urge to allow your brethren to feed. You have advantage on attack rolls made against creatures while both you and the target are in water.

sheet.description: You have advantage on attack rolls made against creatures while both you and the target are in water.

description.p: At 14th level, your transformation into a Deep One is complete. Your type becomes aberration and you gain all of the Innsmouth Mutations.
Additionally, you choose to amplify one of your mutations.
Claws. The damage of your unarmed strikes becomes 1d8 + your Strength modifier. You can make an unarmed strike as a bonus action on your turn.

Fish Eyes. The radius of your darkvision increases to 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, its radius increases by 60 feet. Additionally, you gain blindsight out to a radius of 60 feet while underwater.
Gills. You are immune to airborne and waterborne gas, vapors, toxins, and inhaled poisons.
Long Tongue. You can attempt to grapple a creature as a bonus action on your turn.
Scales. Your bonus to AC increases to +2.
Sharp Teeth. When you make an Intimidation check, you add twice your proficiency bonus.
Slimey Skin. Creatures are poisoned while they are grappling you.
Webbed Feet. You gain a swimming speed equal to twice your walking speed, and you have advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks made to swim.

sheet.description: Your type is aberration.

description.p: The damage of your unarmed strikes becomes 1d8 + your Strength modifier. You can make an unarmed strike as a bonus action on your turn.

sheet.description: You can make an unarmed strike as a bonus action on your turn.

description.p: The radius of your darkvision increases to 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, its radius increases by 60 feet. Additionally, you gain blindsight out to a radius of 60 feet while underwater.
You are immune to airborne and waterborne gas, vapors, toxins, and inhaled poisons.

sheet.description: You are immune to airborne and waterborne gas, vapors, toxins, and inhaled poisons.

description.p: You can attempt to grapple a creature as a bonus action on your turn.

sheet.description: You can attempt to grapple a creature as a bonus action on your turn.

description.p: Your bonus to AC increases to +2.
When you make an Intimidation check, you add twice your proficiency bonus.
Creatures are poisoned while they are grappling you.

sheet.description: Creatures are poisoned while they are grappling you.

description.p: You gain a swimming speed equal to twice your walking speed, and you have advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks made to swim.

sheet.description: You have advantage on Athletics checks made to swim.

description.p: Ithaqua is the chilling wind that blows in the most frozen reaches of the planet. The freezing environment created by Ithaqua always leads to cannibalism, whether from sheer desperation or from madness.
Ithaqua lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

td.em: gust of wind, Snillocâ€™s snowball swarm*

description.p: Starting at 1st level, the hunger that burns through a wendigo fills your body. As an action, you can feast on a dead beast, humanoid, or undead within 5 feet of you. You regain hit points equal to 1d6 + your Constitution modifier. If you use this feature as your action, you can use it again as a bonus action on the same turn but you are considered prone until the start of your next turn.

You can only feed on dead bodies a certain number of times: once for tiny and small creatures, twice for medium, four times for large, eight times for huge, and sixteen times for gargantuan and larger.

sheet.description: You can feast on a dead beast, humanoid, or undead within 5 feet of you. You regain 1d6 + {{constitution:modifier}} hit points. If you use this feature as your action, you can use it again as a bonus action on the same turn but you are considered prone until the start of your next turn.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, you can utter a howl that chills your enemies to the bone. As an action, you can force each creature within 30 feet of you that can hear you to make a Wisdom saving throw or use their reaction to move up to their movement speed away from you without provoking attacks of opportunity. If a creature fails the save by 5 or more, the creature has vulnerability to cold damage until the end of your next turn.
Additionally, you can use your Cannibalism feature as a bonus action on the same turn you use this feature.

sheet.description: You can force each creature within 30 feet of you that can hear you to make a Wisdom saving throw or use their reaction to move up to their movement speed away from you without provoking attacks of opportunity. If a creature fails the save by 5 or more, the creature has vulnerability to cold damage until the end of your next turn. Additionally, you can use your Cannibalism feature as a bonus action on the same turn you use this feature.

description.p: Beginning at 10th level, Ithaqua grants you the ability to summon a polar storm around yourself. As a bonus action, you can summon a howling torrent of snow and ice in a 20-foot radius around you. Any creature that enters that area or starts its turn there or takes cold damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1) and must make a Constitution saving throw or become blinded until the start of its next turn.
Additionally, you have resistance to cold damage and suffer no ill effects of extreme cold.

sheet.description: You can summon a howling torrent of snow and ice in a 20-foot radius around you. Any creature that enters that area or starts its turn there or takes {{arctic-storm:damage}} cold damage and must make a Constitution saving throw or become blinded until the start of its next turn. You suffer no ill effects of extreme cold.

description.p: At 14th level, you are now one with the freezing wind. You gain a fly speed equal to your walking speed, immunity to cold damage, and resistance to thunder damage.
Additionally, you are no longer considered prone while using your Cannibalism feature as a bonus action after you have used it as an action.

sheet.description: You are no longer considered prone while using your Cannibalism feature as a bonus action after you have used it as an action.

description.p: The King in Yellow, also known as He-Who-Is-Not-To-Be-

Named, is all that presides over madness and insanity. His play, named after himself, releases madness upon all those who view it. The performers on the other hand are usually followers of the King and either have the will to resist its power or have embraced wholeheartedly its insanity.
Hastur lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

Starting at 1st level, through constant practice of The King in Yellow, you have become used to its mind-altering effects. You are immune to short-term madness and have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.
At 6th level, you are immune to long-term madness. At 14th level, you are immune to indefinite madness.

sheet.description: You are immune to {{play-rehearsal:madness-duration}} madness and have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, you can imbue an area with unholy energy. As an action, you can choose a 30-foot cube centered within 60 feet of you. For 1 minute, any undead you choose within the area have advantage on saving throws against effects that would turn them and have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons. Additionally, any undead in the area when you use this feature gain temporary hit points equal to your warlock level.
Once you use this feature, you canâ€™t use it again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can choose a 30-foot cube centered within 60 feet of you. For 1 minute, any undead you choose within the area have advantage on saving throws against effects that would turn them and have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons. Additionally, any undead in the area when you use this feature gain {{level:warlock}} temporary hit points.

description.p: Beginning at 10th level, the King in Yellow bestows upon you a boon of undeath. You no longer require food, drink, or air. You can choose to have your type be undead for the purpose of overcoming effects of spells.
Additionally, undead creatures with an Intelligence of 6 or lower are friendly to you unless you attack or cast a spell on them.

sheet.description: You no longer require food, drink, or air. You can choose to have your type be undead for the purpose of overcoming effects of spells. Additionally, undead creatures with an Intelligence of 6 or lower are friendly to you unless you attack or cast a spell on them.

element.name: He Who Is Not to Be Named

description.p: At 14th level, you are now able to harness the power of speaking the true name of the King in Yellow: Hastur. As an action, you speak the name and you and any creature you choose within 30 feet have disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls for a number of rounds equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1).
Once you use this feature, you canâ€™t use it again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You speak the true name of the King in Yellow and you and any creature you choose within 30 feet have disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls {{he-who-is-not-name:duration}} rounds.

description.p: Nyarlathotep is the messenger of the Outer Gods. He is the traveling shapeshifter who brings messages of unintelligable horror or incomprehensible knowledge that leaves the recipients in a state of madness. His followers take on many faces, so it is unknown how many there are, let alone where they all are.
Nyarlathotep lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

Starting at 1st level, Nyarlathotep grants you some of his transformation abilities. You can cast the disguise self spell at will without expending a spell slot. When cast this way, the spell does not fail under physical inspection. Anything created by the spell and height changes are physical and solid but disappear when removed from your body. Additionally, creatures have disadvantage on Intelligence (Investigation) checks to discern that you are disguised.

sheet.description: You can cast the disguise self spell at will without expending a spell slot. When cast this way, the spell does not fail under physical inspection. Additionally, creatures have disadvantage on Investigation checks to discern that you are disguised.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, you are granted with gifts of speed. On your turn, you can move twice your walking speed. Once you use this feature, you canâ€™t use it again until you finish a short rest. You suffer no exhaustion from forced march.
Additionally, you can cast the sending spell without expending a spell slot once per long rest.

sheet.description: On your turn, you can move twice your walking speed. Once you use this feature, you canâ€™t use it again until you finish a short rest. You suffer no exhaustion from forced march. You can cast the sending spell without expending a spell slot once per long rest.

description.p: Beginning at 10th level, Nyarlathotep gives you a mystical shroud that puts a haze around your entire persona. Creatures that interact with you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failure, they are not able to remember anything about your appearance. On a success, they can only remember either your clothing or your facial appearance, but not both.

sheet.description: Creatures that interact with you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failure, they are not able to remember anything about your appearance. On a success, they can only remember either your clothing or your facial appearance, but not both.

description.p: At 14th level, you become a master of transformation. When you cast the polymorph spell, you can change the target to any creature type, not just beast. If you attempt to change a target into another creature that is the same type and size, it has disadvantage on the saving throw.

sheet.description: When you cast the polymorph spell, you can change the target to any creature type, not just beast. If you attempt to change a target into another creature that is the same type and size, it has disadvantage on the saving throw.

description.p: Generally partnered with Ithaqua, Rhan-Tegoth is a large crab-like beast that lives in a cave deep within ice and snow. He sits upon his ivory throne, waiting for his followers to bring him sacrifices upon which to feast. He is also viewed as being immortal, not only from the tributes, but also from his large carapace-like shell.
Rhan-Tegoth lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

Starting at 1st level, Rhan-Tegoth creates an astral shell that protects you. When you finish a long rest, choose either bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage. Until the end of your next long rest, you are resistant to that damage made by non-magical weapons.

sheet.description: When you finish a long rest, choose either bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage. Until the end of your next long rest, you are resistant to that damage made by non-magical weapons.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, you can demand tribute from your enemies. As an action, you can target one creature within 30 feet of you that can cast a spell. It loses a spell slot equal to your warlock spell slot level and you regain one of your expended spell slots. If it does not have a spell slot of that level but has one of higher level, it must make an ability check using its spellcasting ability. The DC for this feature is your spell save DC. On a failure, the creature loses its next lowest spell slot that is above your warlock spell slot level. If the target has no spell slots equal to or higher than your spell slot level, this feature fails.
Once you use this feature, you canâ€™t use it again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can target one creature within 30 feet of you that can cast a spell. It loses a spell slot equal to your warlock spell slot level and you regain one of your expended spell slots.

description.p: Beginning at 10th level, you can enter a state of inactivity like your patron. You can take two long rests in a row and gain benefits from both. Additionally, any effect you have that you can only use a certain number of times per rest can be used twice the normal amount before requiring you to rest as specified by the feature or ability. Starting at 17th level, you can take three long rests in a row, gaining benefits from all three and allowing you to use the features specified above three times before requiring you to rest as specified by the feature or ability.

sheet.description: You can take two long rests in a row and gain benefits from both. Additionally, any effect you have that you can only use a certain number of times per rest can be used twice the normal amount before requiring you to rest as specified by the feature or ability.

You can take three long rests in a row and gain benefits from both. Additionally, any effect you have that you can only use a certain number of times per rest can be used three times the normal amount before requiring you to rest as specified by the feature or ability.

description.p: At 14th level, Rhan-Tegoth demands sacrifices for any further power. Once per long rest, you can perform a 10 minute ritual. During this ritual, you must kill a humanoid and choose one of the following sacrifices.
Empower. In this ritual, you offer the organs of the victim as tribute. Until the end of the next long rest, one ability score of your choice is increased by 2 to a maximum of 22.

Eternal. In this ritual, you offer the blood of the victim as tribute. Until the end of the next long rest, the first time you would die, you return to 1 hit point instead. After this happens, you have advantage on death saving throws until the end of the next long rest.

Siphon. In this ritual, you offer the bones of the victim as tribute. Until the end of the next long rest, you have one additional warlock spell slot. This spell slot cannot be regained by taking a short rest. You expend this spell slot when you have no other spell slots.

sheet.description: Once per long rest, you can perform a 10 minute ritual. During this ritual, you must kill a humanoid and choose one of the following sacrifices: Empower, Eternal, or Siphon.

description.p: The Black Goat of the Woods with a Thousand Young is said to spawn even more creature than Abhoth, being the mother of innumerable abominations. Followers of her worship creatures and tend to wear goat-related attire. They are generally seen as the evil counterpart of the clerics of the life domain.
Shub-Niggurath lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.
Starting at 1st level, Shub-Niggurath aids you in the spawning of your own monsters. When you cast a spell that conjures 1 or more creatures, you summon 1 additional creature.

sheet.description: When you cast a spell that conjures 1 or more creatures, you summon 1 additional creature.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, your summons become more ghoul-like in nature. As an action, any creature youâ€™ve summoned with a spell of 1st level or higher can feast on a dead body within 5 feet of it and gain temporary hit points equal to your warlock level. This ability can only be used once per corpse.

sheet.description: Any creature youâ€™ve summoned with a spell of 1st level or higher can feast on a dead body within 5 feet of it and gain {{level:warlock}} temporary hit points. This ability can only be used once per corpse.

description.p: Beginning at 10th level, Shub-Niggurath, with the mentality of a mother, wants her creations to stay alive and grow. You cannot lose concentration on a spell that conjures 1 or more creatures.

sheet.description: You cannot lose concentration on a spell that conjures 1 or more creatures.

description.p: At 14th level, you can spawn even more monsters to feast on your enemies. When you cast a spell that conjures 1 or more creatures, you can double the amount of creatures it would summon. The spell that you are using this feature on canâ€™t benefit from your Fertility Cult feature unless the spell only summons 1 creature. If the spell summons only 1 creature, you would first double the amount to 2 and then summon an additional creature from Fertility Cult, resulting in a total of 3 creatures.
Once you use this feature, you canâ€™t use it again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: When you cast a spell that conjures 1 or more creatures, you can double the amount of creatures it would summon. The spell that you are using this feature on canâ€™t benefit from your Fertility Cult feature unless the spell only summons 1 creature.

description.p: Tsathoggua, also known as the Sleeper of Nâ€™kai, is the most lazy and lethargic of all the Great Old Ones. He hibernates unless the ancient wizards send him something as a sacrifice. If he does not like the sacrifice, he will then take the bringer of it as one.
Tsathoggua lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

Starting at 1st level, your spells attack your targets from underneath them. Your ranged spell attacks ignore half and three-quarters cover. Additionally, casting a spell that requires a ranged spell attack does not give away your position if you were hidden from the target.

sheet.description: Your ranged spell attacks ignore half and three-quarters cover. Additionally, casting a spell that requires a ranged spell attack does not give away your position if you were hidden from the target.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, you have learned how to recycle some of your power. If all enemy creatures succeed on the saving throw against one of your spells of 1st-level or higher, or all ranged spell attacks miss from a spell of 1st-level or higher, on your next turn, you can spend one action to regain 1 warlock spell slot.
Once you use this feature, you canâ€™t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: If all enemy creatures succeed on the saving throw against one of your spells of 1st-level or higher, or all ranged spell attacks miss from a spell of 1st-level or higher, on your next turn, you can spend one action to regain 1 warlock spell slot.

description.p: Beginning at 10th level, Tsathoggua grants you knowledge granted by other patrons. Choose another otherworldly patron. You learn the features available at 1st level for that patron. When you finish a long rest, you can change your choice, losing any previous features gained with this feature.

sheet.description: Choose another otherworldly patron. You learn the features available at 1st level for that patron. When you finish a long rest, you can change your choice, losing any previous features gained with this feature.

description.p: At 14th level, you have been granted the art of conserving your energy to expend it all at one time. At the start of your turn, you can choose to hold your entire turn until your turn the next round. On your turn during the round after you use this ability, you can expend 1 warlock spell slot to hold your current turn and any previously held turns until your turn the next round. During this time, you cannot take reactions.

Once you choose to not use this feature and act on your turn, you must use all of your turns. When doing so, it is treated as taking the turns immediately after one another. For example, if this is the third round of combat and you have held your first turn and expended a spell slot to hold your second turn in addition, you have three turns to use. If you use your action and bonus action, then take another action, the movement from your first turn is gone, but you can still move as part of your second and third turns.
Additionally, after you take all of your turns held by this feature, you have a number of reactions equal to the turns held, until the start of your next turn.

description.p: The Opener of the Way, Yog-Sothoth, is the mate of Shub-

Niggurath. He is the maker of portals, and he allows and controls which ones are made when and where. Every time one of his followers creates such a portal, they believe that traveling through it brings them closer to their patron.
Yog-Sothoth lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

td.em: conjure minor elementals, freedom of movement

description.p: Starting at 1st level, you briefly touch on the power of gates. When a creature would hit you with an attack, you can use your reaction to teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you, causing the attack to automatically miss. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum once). You regain all uses of this feature when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: When a creature would hit you with an attack, you can teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you, causing the attack to automatically miss.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, Yog-Sothoth empowers your teleportation. When you would teleport or travel to another plane of existence, you can teleport 1 additional creature within 5 feet of you, in addition to the number you would be able to teleport. For example, you would be able to teleport yourself and 1 other creature using your Dragon Descending feature and you would be able to teleport yourself and 2 other creatures with the dimension door spell. The additional creature appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. Any creature that would appear in an occupied space are subjected to the spellâ€™s effects as if they were casting the spell.

description.p: Beginning at 10th level, you can beg to Yog-Sothoth to have his power flow through you. On your turn, you can use your action and bonus action to regain all of your warlock spell slots.

description.p: At 14th level, you are the gate and the key. You can cast any conjuration spell that causes you or another creature to teleport or travel to another plane as a bonus action on your turn or as a reaction when you take damage. You must know the spell and be able to expend a spell slot to cast the spell.
